column4: I have a drive on this machine that is still ntfs.....is there an easy way to change it to a more linux compatable filesystem without loosing all data?
shrink it somehow, create a new partition of equal/greater size, copy all data over, then expand the ext3 partition.
use either a partition magic boot cd or maybe even gparted live cd. i dunno i haven't  ever done this, but that's what you need to do.
